Are there any plans for powerful viewpathing capabilites?
Nmake has been doing it for years and also
supports java dependency checking (jdeps).

I see you call make files "inherently evil",
but the fact is that Nmake offers a very
important feature that you fail to mention
in your sales pitch - INCREMENTAL BUILDS.

I presume you are referring to Lucent's nmake (as opposed to Microsoft's nmake)?

How would you see this working in Ant's context? 

As for "INCREMENTAL BUILDS", I'm not sure exactly what you are getting at?

If you've got some suggestions about how "viewpathing" could work, I'd be
interested to hear them.
creator: conor@apache.org
ah08010-apache@yahoo.com
text:
(In reply to comment #1)
> If you've got some suggestions about how "viewpathing" could work, I'd be
> interested to hear them.

If filesets, etc, were to allow a "pathref=" or "path=", in stead of "dir=",
that would be a pretty good start.

The expected behavior would be similar to the SOURCEPATH behavior -- find the
first unique filename on the path.

To make this applicable in the maximum number of places, it were probably best
to have a special tag <vpath ...> a la <path>. The difference being that <vpath>
never yields the same basename twice:

<vpath ...>
  <pathelement ... source/ ...>
  <pathelement ... othersource/ ...>
</vpath>

When you use a vpath instead of a path, of "SomeName.ext" is located in source/,
then the copy of SomeName.ext in othersource/ is not reported.

creator: mbenson@apache.org
text:
in 1.7 this would be trivial for a (developer) user to implement by extending
<path>.  Since all tasks for which it makes sense support resourcecollections,
the resulting <vpath> type would automatically be supported.
